intro: Struthiola erecta, commonly known as the upright struthiola, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the warmer months. Struthiola erecta is often found in rocky or dry habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
